Name: anthelios mineral tinted ultra light face sunscreen fluid spf 50
protect + glow daily sunscreen gel broad spectrum spf 30
comments: * If you want to glow that will compete with the sunshine, you found it. It's a nice lotion that applies easy. Give it several minutes to dry down before you continue with your make up routine. It has nice broad spectrum protection. Now as I like some glow products because they add a little illumination from within Under your make up, this one was pretty glowy. I didn't need highlighter. In fact, I needed a little bit of modifying powder to tone it down a bit in areas. I didn't want that much glow. If you want to make your matte finish blush have a little more luminosity, this will give a nice base for that effect. * ive tecently started this and it is now my fvsorite prinerr is not inly primes but makes your skin glow * The fact that this has UVA and UVB protection is so huge. I wear this hiking, paddle boarding, at work, etc. and never get burnt. This sunscreen does leave a nice dew, however, you do need to caution against using too much product bc then you might look a lottle greasy and may get a little pilling. Unless they substantially change the formula, this will be a product i always make sure I have plenty of. * I have been using this for years! I love the moisture and glow it gives. * Maybe ok for oily skin but this makes my dry skin SO dry and tight. Yuck. * I have tried many face sunscreens. A lot of them would burn my sensitive skin and make my eyes water, make my skin red, or leave a white cast. This stuff does none of those things! It doesnt even feel like Im wearing sunscreen, nor does it smell like sunscreen! It gives a beautiful, radiant glow to your skin. I get compliments all the time saying "wow your skin looks so good!" and "you have such a glow!" I used to be self conscious of my uneven, reddish skin tone and would only feel confident if I was wearing foundation or BB cream. Now i have ditched those products, and feel completely confident wearing only this product out because it gives such a radiant glow (its not sparkly, either). I have almost finished the jumbo bottle and plan to buy another one when all Tula products go on sale for 25% off on Sunday, which helps because it's pricey. Highly recommend! * I absolutely LOVE this sunscreen! I first purchased it two years ago and its now a staple in my skincare routine. I used to have dry skin and now have a bit more oily skin as my skin has changed a bit and it still works wonderfully. It leaves the most beautiful glow to your skin 💛

Name: anthelios ultra light fluid face sunscreen spf 60

comments:
* Love the joy of having fun when applying
Blends in pretty good * love it * I absolutely love this sunscreen! It's not sunblock, it's sunscreen… not the same thing…. I love the way this feels! It absorbs nicely, and leaves my skin feeling soft and moisturized, not greasing and slimy like a lot of other sunscreens, which is nice if you have a weird thing about what you put on your body. With that being said, this is a BODY sunscreen. Most sunscreens say they can be used on the face, but there are sunscreens that are designed specifically for application of the FACE. If you purchased this for your face after seeing it on social media and it didn't work the way you wanted it to, that's a you problem. This is the BEST BODY sunscreen I think I've ever used, as I have a sunscreen specifically formulated for my face. And it smells amazing, to boot! It smells the way your skin smells after being at the pool all day, its beachy and mildly coconutty but in an all day pool day kind of way. Imagine you're at a pool at your favorite resort, its hot and sunny and you've been applying sunscreen and drinking pina coladas. Its they way you skin would smell after a day like that! I loved it so much, I bought the perfume too. Oh yeah, and its sun protection is awesome! Name: anthelios melt-in milk body & face sunscreen lotion spf 100

* So i bought 2 of these. Thinkining i could use

And i will not purchase again. * I have both lupus and a condition called MCAS- the latter essentially meaning I'm allergic to anything and everything, and the "rules" of what I'm allergic to changes daily- this is the one and ONLY sunscreen that doesn't cause my butterfly rash to burn or trigger an even worse full faced MCAS rash, and even better: no acne! Literally everything breaks me out or causes a reaction but not this. I am so happy to have found this SPF. My skin no longer feels like I'm pressed against a hot skillet when I have to be outside anymore. Of course, always wear a sunhat and clothing layers to protect your skin, too! But this truly is a miracle product for me. I hope to never be without it. Please, please, please, never discontinue or stop carrying this product. I was in tears to find something that works for me. I've never loved a peofuct more. * I love this sunscreen, was using the spf 60 and found this spf 100 at ulta. It's hard to find. The last few years I have developed a sensitivity to the sun beyond what normal people do. This stops my sun reactions and I don't look grey. Re-apply! * okay this sunscreen is actually really good! it doesnt break me out(which my skin is super sensitive to break outs and redness), gives me a slight glow, and obviously its spf 100 which is lovely for my fair skin. however, i play tennis a lot and even when im out for like 5 minutes and this is on my face i sweat like CRAZY even though im not even hot or tired or any of that. and when i actually do get hot and work out for a long time dear lord it looks like i just went on a 5k marathon through death valley. it doesnt bug me that much cause its protecting my skin but it is sorta annoying. also omg for the love of god do NOT get this anywhere near your eyes. i got this near my eyes and no matter how much i washed them or wiped my eyes my eyes were burning for 3+ hours. literally. they were watering so bad and i was blinking every millisecond and couldnt barely do anything. other than that its a really solid sunscreen if one you dont put it near your eyes and two you dont mind sweating(if youre being active/doing sports). * It's been too long since I last used sunscreen, but I recently started again because my skin tone was becoming uneven and the UV index has been high lately, ranging from 6 to 9 between 10 AM and 4 PM. I've noticed that my skin is returning to its regular shade. As a person with brown skin who spends about two hours a day in the sun, I recommend applying sunscreen every 90 minutes if you're exposed for a long time. It's a great product! * I honestly LOVE this formula. I was a little intimidated by the SPF 100 and was scared it was going to be thick and difficult to blend but I'm halway through my bottle and it's performing excellently! I've been using the SPF 60 for 3 years now and wanted to see if this was any different and I think I like this one better for makeup than the SPF 60. This one settles and dries down more than the SPF 60 surprisingly so I find it easier to apply makeup over this and I also dont feel like this gives me the "sunscreen sheen" on my face as much as fhe other one does which I found super surprising. There is a sliiight white cast but it's not really more noticeable than the SPF 60 white cast and both are pretty minimal. Can streak sometimes but that's very minimal too and I find it less streaky than the SPF 60 surprisingly. The only draw in my book is this tends to have a shorter expiration date than the SPF 60 but I'm sure it's hard to keep a ln SPF 100 formulation at 100 for an extended period of time. I hope they never discontinue this! Makes me feel more comfortable on the sunniest days (and ofc I reapply) * I use this specifically on my HEALED tattoos to keep them as protected as possible

Although correlation doesn't equal causation - this product feels a little thick, making it a little hard to blend. It also feels oily/greasy on my face. I wore it for two weeks straight for a vacation & ran into two issues with it: over that extended period of time, it seemed to build up on my face and leave me with textural issues. I suspect this is because I didn't have access to any cleansing oils + was in new locations with different water, so I'm not going to place that blame on Vacation. I would just use a cleansing oil in the future. The scent, however, is my bigger issue. It smells delightful, I just don't want scented products for my face. Vacation does seem to be receptive to feedback, so hopefully one day we'll get an unscented version. Back to the product. I am a black woman with a caramel toned complexion. After complete application, there is a slight but tolerable white cast. It does have a fairly strong scent but not unpleasant or crazy. It's easy to apply and the coverage is light with a satin finish.  

I would repurchase and recommend.

Name: daily essentials spf starter kit

Yesterday I went out boating for four hours and I relied only on this little kit. The Refresh spray was nice for reapplication, which I only remembered once, halfway through the day. I didn't get burned at all, even under these harshest conditions. 

The Play Everyday lotion was fine. It worked well and I definitely would have burned without it, as I missed a few spots and am absolutely fried. It just doesn't stand out above other sunblocks to me. 

Nonetheless, I'm very happy that I ordered this kit. These aren't cheap products but the quality is excellent and I don't skimp on skincare. This kit allows you to try each and see how your skin responds before investing in larger sizes. * These are so small they should be free samples. Name: shimmer oil spf 30 sunscreen
comments:
* Used it once while on vacation. Gave me the worst hives that have stayed for days. Developed into a heat rash and now I cant go in the sun and I'm miserable wirh itching. Would not recommend. * I love this!! First iff, it smells amazing. I havent smelled the perfume but if it smells like this I will be buying it!!! I have pretty sensitive skin (&eczema) so I have to be careful about what I use on my skin. This didn't irritate my skin at all. It gave my olive skin a nice bronzey glow (my phototype is between a 3&4) without looking like a fake tan. Its similar to Sol De Janeiro Glow Oil in Copacabana which i also love, but this has actual SPF so that makes it better!! It also absorbs better than SDJ. * I love the shimmer in this beautiful SPF oil. I dont find it to be glittery at all. If im buying something called "shimmer," i want some shimmer, and this has enough to be visible but not overwhelming. I'm tired of products claiming to have shimmer that just have a greasy shine without actual sparkle. You can rub this around to minimize the shimmer - it can get quite subtle if you prefer, or layer it if you want more sparkle. The scent is nice too, not too strong. * Im glad to report i didn't experience anything negative from this like some reviews say. This product is amazing , i get so many compliments on how pretty this shimmer leaves my arms and legs 😍 * This product works better than the higher end products. The quality is amazing for the price. The glitter glow literally GLOWS and lasts all day. I wore this product to sleep and worked out in it and it stays on. A plus that is smells amazing. * This product was DANGEROUS for me, my skin (mostly arms) had the worse reaction to it and broke out completely in hives. 
I'm a huge fan of the Vacation brand products. I especially enjoy their SPF baby oil, so I couldn't wait to try the shimmer oil. I've never had this reaction to any sunscreens, oils, fragrances or anything really but this was BAD.

The worse part is it's been around 5 days and my skin is still itchy and broken out. Do not recommend (ironically especially don't try it while on vacation like me!) * I rarely return things but I had to remove this from my life after 1 wear. I don't know if I'm the Vacation audience - as I live very far from a beach - but I have very fair skin and fantasized a bronzy, glamorous way to get a little SPF and a nice scent in the summer. Sadly this wasn't what I imagined. It's very oily, and throughout the many hours I wore it, it never absorbed. If it's hot you'll be sticky and greasy. The "shimmer" looks like actual glitter flecks on the skin rather than a nice glisten. (Took multiple showers to fully remove the glitter.) The glitter got on all my clothes and the oil left marks on my car seats. Lastly, being as pale as I am it made me look actually yellow.

Again, maybe I'm not the target audience, maybe if I were purely wearing this to lay by the pool it'd be fine.. but I find it pretty impractical for just a normal day-type body care product. Smells good, but I'd rather just buy the perfume.

Name: piÃ±a colada classic body organic sunscreen spray spf 30
comments:
* I am loving COOLA right now. This SPF is perfect for this dreadful Texas humidity and heat. It's very lightweight, non-greasy, and has a pleasant scent. Reapplying is a breeze since the product doesn't build up on the skin or cause a film. It's very breathable and works well with general skin sensitivities. The size is quite large for travel, but still small enough to throw in your beach bag and still have space for other necessities. It has a click-locking spray top so it doesn't accidentally spray in your bag. I will say that if your skin is very dry, you may want to go for a cream SPF because this does not provide much moisture. This is definitely made for hot, sunny summers. I love it and I know for sure I am buying a full-sized bottle to keep on hand.

***This review was collected as part of a promotion.*** * As a professional in the beauty industry, I've learned firsthand the  importance of sun protection, making COOLA's  spray an indispensable asset. In an industry where skincare is very important, COOLA stands out with its dedication to not only protecting against harmful UV rays but also enhancing the overall experience of sun care.

COOLA's sunscreen spray doesn't just shield your skin from UVA and UVB rays; Its broad-spectrum protection ensures comprehensive coverage, safeguarding against both premature aging and potential skin damage. As someone deeply invested in skin health, I love COOLA's commitment to providing a product that protects and cares for my skin.

The scent of Piña Colada fragrance is delicious. Gone are the days of sunscreen smelling like, well, sunscreen. Instead, COOLA's tropical scent transports me to my last vacation. It's a big change from the clinical smell of traditional sunscreens, making the application process a sensory experience.

I did not have any issue in my delicate skin but I always recommend  a patch test.

In my personal opinion, COOLA's in spray isn't just a sun protection product; it's an  evolution of skincare. With its comprehensive protection, anti-aging benefits, and irresistible Piña Colada scent, COOLA has redefined what it means to stay safe in the sun. So, whether I am lounging by the pool or hitting the beach, I make COOLA my go-to companion for summer adventures. And a big pus smells delicious! * The COOLA Piña Colada Classic Body Organic Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 offers a delightful sun protection experience. Its tropical scent evokes visions of sunny beaches and relaxation, enhancing the application process with a touch of indulgence. The organic formula boasts SPF 30, providing reliable protection against both UVA and UVB rays, crucial for preventing sunburn and long-term skin damage. What sets this sunscreen apart is its lightweight texture, which absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy or sticky residue. This feature is particularly appealing for those who dislike the heavy feeling often associated with sunscreen application. The spray mechanism ensures effortless and even coverage, making it convenient for reapplication throughout the day, especially during outdoor activities. Furthermore, the use of organic ingredients adds to its appeal for those who prioritize natural  products. 

 In conclusion, the COOLA Piña Colada Classic Body Organic Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 offers a luxurious and effective sun protection solution for those who appreciate both quality and indulgence in their routine. * As a licensed Esthetician, we our taught early on how important using SPF to protect our skin. Make sure to reapply this sunscreen every 80 minutes. I would recommend this to anyone of any age who loves the sun and wants to have lightweight, long lasting and fast absorbing sun protection that also keeps your skin hydrated too. * Sun care is very important because it can help prevent skin cancer. I'm talking about a half an inch worth of product in the 3.5 inch tall tube… The packaging clearly says 0.7 oz, but you don't realize how little that is. * found this and said oh perfect! needed something to keep in my bag for sunscreen on long motorcycle trips. this is a great size teardrop shaped stick that goes on smooth and clear, smells really nice and light. definitely would recommend this to everyone! packaging is also on point ☝🏻 * The only way I will be applying SPF from now on! This sunscreen stick is pocket size, put it in your purse, beach bag… & your good to go. I love the way it feels on my skin, giving me a natural looking glow. Absolutely no white cast, as this goes on clear. I definitely reccomend! * The Vacations Sunscreen Stick is fantastic! It's compact and easy to carry, making reapplication throughout the day a breeze. 

The formula is smooth, non-greasy, and provides excellent sun protection. Plus, it has a pleasant scent and doesn't leave a white cast. Perfect for on-the-go sun care! * I'm absolutely in love with the Vacation Super Stick SPF 45! The edgy shape ensures precise application, and it makes my skin feels very silky smooth. It goes on clear with a beautiful satin finish that felt perfect under my makeup. As someone with oily skin, I appreciate that it doesn't cause any breakouts or extra oiliness to my skin. I highly recommend!

Name: classic body organic sunscreen spray spf 30 tropical coconut
comments: * I have been using coola products for years! I love the products. Good quality! Love the smell of the scented ones.

Name: sensitive mineral sunscreen lotion spf 50+
comments: * Just got back from 9 nights in Cancun, and I'm tan with no burn at all thanks to this stuff! Unlike most white mineral sunscreens, this one actually soaks in & leaves no cast on your skin. It also feels super moisturizing and keeps you from burning! * Just bought this to tan. A lot of other sunscreens will still have me leaving (slightly) burnt no matter how many times I re-apply even if its before the recommend time. But with this sunscreen, i tanned out in the sun (under the amount of time before i needed to re-apply) and i didnt burn even a little!!! Very effective and works well, but it really does leave a bad white cast which is the downside because the white cast is very noticeable and doesn't blend away. I also find this sunscreen to be very greasy compared to other's but it doesn't bother me as much as the white cast does. * It's so oily and leaves a huge white cast. It's terrible. * Went on a trip to Hawaii and needed a reef safe sunscreen. Use this before on my face and I will say it was too greasy. However, this time I used it on my body and it was perfect. Would definitely use again in the future for body * This is the greasiest sunscreen I've ever used.  I hate it so much.  My skin stayed greasy for over an hour after applying.  This stuff is an oil slick. * This gives me a white cast at first but blends in quickly. Leaves a slight greasy feel but tolerable. This doesn't break me out or irritate my skin at all which is great. I like that it's reef safe and has a cool color-changing cap.

Name: unseen sunscreen spf 40

Name: better screen uv serum sunscreen spf 50+

I'm sure Kiehls would be great for people with dry skin! * I will forvere use this product. The serum texture makes it an amaing last skincare step. In love is an understatement. * Im a MUA of 20+ yrs. Where has this been all my life, Im on my 2nd bottle and not only that but I broke my ankle and didnt use for 1 week and I had wrinkles on my forehead I never knew I had, started using it again religiously and I mean every time I'm outside every two hours like you're supposed to with SPF. And with the collogen and other delicious stuff afteIm 41 and look you ger than my 35 year old hus and and those lines are GONE AGAIN. How are there only 8 revies on this!! I get it its very exspensive for a "sunscreen" but if your not using 50 on  your face every 2 hours outside sun/shade your damaging your skin and it was only when I found this that I saw the significant difference. I have hyper sensitive skin and hated using SPF's before esp in combo with any skin care because it just never felt right on my face or had any benefits so always did both seperate. Never again!! I dont work or have affiliation with the brand or product it's just that amazing and I have to tell you it is worth every little penny please don't let the price tag scare you because what it will give you back will save you all the injectables. You do all the facials that you get it is truly mind blowing. I will never go without this and make sure I have an extra bottle before I run low. This is how I think…. Whats your skin/ youth looking face worth to you and too try it for free for 60 days and see the results or get your $$ back why wouldnt you!!! * Lightweight face sunscreen that doesn't leave a sticky, greasy, or opaque residue. Skin feels soft and nourished. After two wears, I feel like this will be a staple. Reasonable price is the icing on the cake.

Name: sensitive mineral sunscreen spray spf 50+
comments: * I don't usually leave reviews, but I was super disappointed in this one.  The nozzle stopped working almost immediately, I didn't even get one leg fully covered before it clogged up.  Luckily I had a backup lotion with me. Other Blue Lizard products have been great. * I would say this product is a firm no for me as I PERSONALLY experienced a minor allergic reaction on my arms and it made them really itchy with small bumps. I had high hopes it would work fantastically as it's mineral with high spf but it's unfortunately a no for me :( * I love Blue Lizard's other products, but the spray nozzle stopped working only after a couple of sprays. * Sirays on so easy. Applies with minimal effort to rub in after spraying on. Has the most mild scent out if all the products, probably due to the application process. It wirks so well. Full day of baseball camp, and my son had zero burns at all. Just a beautiful tan. Highly recommened this product. * I bought this for a trip to Maui with my husband. The bottle looks to be a decent size - a little smaller than your average spray sunscreen container. The product itself worked well. There was a slight white cast but it wasn't bad. It felt like it was stuck to our skin (in a good way) and definitely protected us from the sun. HOWEVER... The bottle literally lasted  us 2 applications each, so 4 full body applications total! And we are relatively small people. Is this a joke?? Good thing that was all we needed for our trip, but that's DEFINITELY not worth the money. Such a bummer!

Name: self reflect probiotic moisturizing sunscreen spf 32
comments:
* I really like this sunscreen, because it's cruelty-free, gentle, & NON-water-resistant.  I have used it on my face  over cruelty-free spf30 moisturizer, my arms, & legs.  It has a pleasant vanilla smell & uses tumeric & other gentle ingredients.  I was disappointed in the expiration date, however, & returned it.  Will order another one online to hopefully get a better exp. date.  I recommend it highly! * I love this sunscreen! It is one of the only ones I've tried that doesn't break me out. I have normal, but dehydrated skin that is fairly sensitive and acne prone. The zinc oxide in this sunscreen really helps calm redness and irritation in my skin and is somewhat hydrating whereas some sunscreens I've tried for acne prone skin were too drying for me. I used this for years and decided to try other sunscreens, but I ended up coming back to this one as others i tried just didnt compare. * It leaves a dewy sheen, has a pleasant smell, and did not break me out. For me, it was just too thick feeling on my skin, so I will be returning. But, I really do get why it's popular. * I have been using this sunscreen for a while (probably almost 2 years). I do mix in a little bit of tinted sunscreen from another brand, but can wear this on its own. The best things about this sunscreen are that it wears well under makeup and it provides amazing protection. My make up lasts just as long with this underneath, and does not change the finish. Sometimes I feel like it makes it look better. 

The protection on this is phenomenal. I went to an all day concert this weekend, and used this with my holy grail foundation that lasts through almost anything and for over 15 hours. I forgot to put sunscreen on my arms for the first hour, and got a little red even though I put sunscreen on pretty early. However, my face was not burned AT ALL, and I was in the sun a lot. 

I dont usually wear this one on its own, I usually wear a more tinted one if I am not wearing makeup, but this is my favorite sunscreen under make up, hands down, and the highest % protection out of any of my other sunscreens. Highly recommend! * I have been trying so many different sunscreens and so many i havent liked. The kinship is amazing and its great for dry skin. Works well with the vitimin C serum im uaong. I will definitely repurchase * I have tried so many sunscreens for the face. A lot of them are nice, but eventually break me out. The ones that don't make my eyes water, and make me look very oily. This sunscreen looks very nice on the face. It evens out my skin tone a bit, and moisturizes. It can be a little tacky, but the finish looks so nice, I don't mind. Some days I use a light hand and dust some setting powder over top. This gives a nice glow, while letting your natural skin tone shine through. Definitely give us a try. * This is my holy grail.  22.4% NON-NANO zinc and NO butyloctyl salicylate?  Amazing.  I have very sensitive skin, and the light vanilla fragrance doesn't bother my skin, but watch out for that if you are sensitive to fragrance.

Name: anthelios aox daily antioxidant face serum spf 50
clear face oil-free sunscreen spf 50
comments: * This is the only sunscreen I've used in my face that didn't make me break out in white heads, and is one of the few that doesn't leave a white cast on my skin (I'm black). I dont vary in my skincare but when I do to wear this…I break out. I also like the pump dispenser. very convenient to use. * I normally don't leave reviews but, this sunscreen is amazing so it was time. 
My family and I have been using this for a few years now. I originally purchased a smaller bottle to try on my youngest daughter who has very sensitive skin. Every sunscreen I tried on her burnd her skin till I tried this sunscreen. We never looked back! My husband, children, and I are white hispanics and my niece is a dark hispanic and I am happy to say it doesn't leave that terrible white cast on any of us a lot of other sunscreens leave on the skin. Non of us think it's greasy and it has a subtle delightful sent. My husband would prefer the price be lower but he knows you pay good money for quality and it lasts us a long time so its now husband approved.

Name: travel size sun shield body glow gel spf 50

I also had to get rid of a cover up because the oil residue transferred and stained it.   I was so disappointed because I usually love this brand. * I was really excited about this product. I applied generously and every 40 minutes like the directions. No water or anything. I am absolutely fried. I know oil attracts sun but i thought a 50 SPF product would do something. Extremely disappointing with how expensive. I do like the face product! Although now weary of its potentcy. Have not found out as i keep my face shielded anyways. * This product smells amazing and I'm sure does great on the sunscreen portion but as for the "glow" or "iridescence" this product just leaves your skin looking greasy. Name: travel size classic body organic sunscreen spray spf 50
comments:
* This sunscreen is fantastic! Love the guava mango scent! I used this while paddle boarding on the lake in my bikini all day in 100° temps. I reapplied once mid day and no sunburn! I use self tanner but this was my first big day in the hot summer sun. * I love Coola sunscreen. The spray applies well. I bought the travel size since I was going on vacation and only bringing a carry on and the regular size would be too big. I was a tad disappointed that these did not last the entire week. My husband and I were the only ones using the spray and we brought 2 new travel bottles with us, but they only made it to about 2/3 of the vacation. It would be nice if there was a TSA approved size that could go a little further. Besides that though, it had a good application that lasted well and as always, I love the scent. * Its an anazing product. Snells anazing, and definitely fets the job done. My only negative is that its a chemical sunscreen. Great for occational use, but not a daily summer sunscreen bc of that. * My husband and I had the worst experience with this product today, so I ran to the reviews to see if others had a problem with it. Sure enough, others mentioned that they burned badly & quickly when using this product. We spent 1 hour in overcast weather, me wearing a long sleeve hoodie, before the sun came out and we decided to wear our T shirts and SPF. We were super confused when very shortly afterwards, we were BURNED!! This wasn't the most intense sun either. I tried to protect myself & my husband with this product and it caused more harm than good. 0/10, don't even risk it. * I used this sunscreen at the beach and didnt get sunburnt at all! I have very sensitive skin and burn very badly. It was easy to apply, not greasy, and fragrance free. My only reason for giving 4 stars is the price and if you go in the water it'll wash off immediately. But I would still buy it again for another beach trip! * The smell was so strong. It smelled extremely fake, like a chemical. I couldn't try it in the store, so I tried it when I got home and returned it the next day. 
It is not something to buy because it is easy to apply. * I just bought a bottle one month ago and it's empty. I dont over spray and maybe use it every weekend. it costs to mucj to go through it so fast.

Name: clear sunscreen stick spf 50+
comments:
* I travel for work and this is perfect to have on the road. Effective, no odor, smooth and non greasy * Bought this based off of the reviews here and I am so glad I did. I was looking for a sunscreen specifically for face. This was exactly what i was looking for. It's clear, not sticky, glides on smoothly, conveniently sized. I need something to quickly put on before running out the door and this makes it easy to apply all over the face and neck area. I havent used this under makeuo yet but i am sure it wouldnt be an issue since there is no residue it leaves on the skin, it is truly smooth and feels like nothing is on. The only possible con for some might be that there is a slight fragrance. It is a VERY subtle fragrance, it reminds me of Softsoap handsoap, but it does not linger by any means. It's more like once you apply it its there but vanishes within a min maybe less? It didnt cause any irritation whatsoever. * I bought this to take on a trip and i could definitely see the difference between spots that I used the stick vs missed spots. Doesn't feel greasy and I love how easy it is to carry in my purse so I can reapply more frequently. * Bought this to try a stick cause since typical cream sunscreen always ends up in my eye I sweat and causes my eyes to sting. Used it for the first time on a lake day and only applied once - my face and neck were the only two body parts that left without sunburn. It's now my go to for everyday use, glides on super smooty, doesnt leave a film, and doesnt feel heavy on your face. Okay Im done rambling now, just go buy it. * I have sensitive skin and combination oily/dry skin. Tried this sunscreen for a couple months. I started to break out with big and painful acne which I hadn't had for many years. Would not recommend for acne prone skin. * I do not have sensitive skin, mostly normal sometimes a little dry depending on season. I was excited to try this sunscreen stick since it's very popular. It leaves the skin super shiny, and it broke me out so much. It really clogged my pores. * It's expensive and worth every penny. 

I have very fair skin and never got a burn while using this. It doesn't melt in the heat and has no overpowering fake smell. 

I've recommended this to so many people and have them hooked as well. The moment they try mine they're blown away by how it doesn't feel like a typical sunscreen.

No weird smell, It does leave a slight tint on the skin, just looks like a tan. Would 100% buy again * I really like this formula. It covers well and it's fragrant but not too heavy or greasy. It did pretty well in the water too. * I don't get much sun exposure because I like to stay indoors mostly, BUT I use this still to keep my skin young! Doesn't at all leave a greasy or sticky residue and rubs in really easily! I will say careful when spraying if you have tile or wood floors cause it'll be slippery at first but it honestly dries up pretty quickly

Name: hydrating sheer sunscreen face and body lotion with spf 30
comments: * I honestly want to love this sunscreen however the white cast it leaves is hard to deal with. I probably would have just continued using it despite the white cast because most everything els eahout it is amazing however my skin was clear and then consequently broke out after a week of using. This product is most wverything i want in a sinscreen, easy to blend, leaves you glowy, and is hydrating, while its difficult to know exactly what broke me out, ive had simular issues in the past with ceraveas sunscreens so im pretty sure thats the culprate. Its also not very high spf so maybe i wasnt applying often enough but it left me still burnt HOWEVER after applying it it will leave you looking like you havent seen the sunlight a day in your life because the white cast is so bad you just look pale. I wouldnt say dont buy this product bc theres lots of pros to it that i havent found in other sunscreens yet so honestly its a win loose with this product you just gotta pick your poison. * I figured I'd try their sunscreen since Cerave is amazing for my skin in general, but their suncare line is not for everyone. It didnt blend seemlessly as the bottle advertised, and instead I looked like unfinished pottery. * I have bought SO MANY sunscreens and hope that they don't leave a white cast. As someone with colored skin I have struggled hard with finding a sunscreen that doesn't take forever to rub in or leave a whitecast. This is probably one of the best ones I have tried! It's also easy to rub on kiddo's too, especially their face. * Product was as described.  Sheer, blended in smoothly. * Tried this on recommendation. Ugh. Name: glow oil spf 50 dry body oil sunscreen

I am very happy with the results and definitely recommend it for when you're ouf in swimwear to have a nice glow. 

HOWEVER, it is greasy just so you know. But it still gets 5 stars because it works so well * I was excited to purchase this product since i have used orher products from this brand, however this one is the WORST! I agree with other poor reviews and also believe the oil amplified the burn. So dissapointed because i wanted to love it, but it does the opposite of protecting your skin despite having a SPF 50 protection claim. * The first few words on the back of this bottle are "clean chemical sunscreen actives" but this isnt a clean product if that's what you're looking for.

Would buy this again. * I find this sunscreen perfect for sitting under makeup or wearing it alone. * This sunscreen has Butyloctyl Salicylate, a cousin to octisalate, and a chemical UV absorber. That's how they can get a higher SPF with such a low concentration of Zinc or TO. So it isn't purely mineral. I like it and use it, but I wish they wouldn't market it as 100% mineral when it has unregulated chemical UV absorbers in it.

Name: sheer mineral sunscreen lotion for face spf 50+
comments: * I tried the blue lizzard Sheer Mineral Sunscreen Lotion for Face SPF 50+ and I was very impressed. It is very lightweight and goes on sheer. I have very dry skin and most mineral sunscreens leave my skin uncomfortably dry after 2 hours. This is not the case with the blue lizzard sunscreen. I am able to wear it and reaply without my skin feeling uncomfortable. This is a great product for the price. * When applying the proper amount, it does leave a white cast on brown skin. But feels great on skin * I was recommended by a dermalogist to use blue lizard. I have dark brown spots.I have been using this product for over 6 years. I have noticed a difference on my face. * I've heard nothing but good things about this brand and when I ran out of my current face sunscreen, I decided to try this one. I love that it's an SPF50. That's honestly the only positive thing I can say about this sunscreen. It comes out pretty runny, but it's the consistency of Elmer's Glue and I imagine that this is exactly what it would feel like if you tried to rub glue into your face. On top of being difficult to apply, it leaves a horrible white cast. This one was a miss for me. * Works incredibly well. Mild scent, but liquidy. Does take a little longer to rub in because of the consistency. However, it works! My son had a small pink spot after a full day of sun on his face. A little after suncare and the next day the pink spot was gone. Highly recommened * Blue Lizard is an excellent sunscreen.  I wanted to like this.  I need something I can wear under makeup.  This made my face look and feel very shiny/oily/sticky. * This product is very light and not heavy like normal sun screen.

Name: daily 50 face gel
comments: * this sunscreen basically acts like a silcone primer that smoothes and fills in prores while having a gripping affect. your skin just feels so immaculate thats the only word to describe it. i would moisturize your skin thoroughly and wait 5 minutes to let it absorb then wait at least 5 minutes before putting on any kind of makeup, you wont be disappointed. * This daily SPF gel is lightweight, glides on easily and doesn't give your face the typical white sunscreen cast.  It comes out of the bottle a little watery and then feels like silk as your rubbing it into your skin.  I love that this has a high SPF than most facial sunscreens. * If you've ever tried the Supergoop invisible sunscreen, this is practically the same thing for HALF the cost! Though highly raved about, I personally never enjoyed the Supergoop formula because the heavy silicone texture was off-putting and did nothing for my dry skin. It just felt like I was wearing a slippery silicone mask all day. I prefer dewy SPF lotions for this reason. They provide hydration and protection all in one. However, I love Sun Bum sunscreens so I still wanted to give this a try! The term "gel" is slightly misleading because it makes you think of a cooling gel consistency which this is not. This is definitely that same silicone texture, but the formula has a more hydrating quality to it. The silicone base gives it a mattifying texture which makes it invisible on the skin. The more exciting part: this is weightless and DOES NOT BURN THE EYES! I have yet to find a single U.S. chemical sunscreen that doesn't burn my eyes into oblivion. I don't know how this formula would hold up on the beach or under extreme sweating/activity, but I fully recommend (as it's advertised) for daily wear or under makeup. Sun Bum is killing it! * This is hands down the best-looking sunscreen I've ever tried.  Unlike other gel sunscreens, this one doesn't pill. * This contains coconut oil as one of the first ingredients.  If you are easily acne prone and/or prone to clogged pores stay away.  Coconut oil is HIGHLY comedogenic.  It would be nice if they created a facial sunscreen that is noncomedogenic. * I used sunscreen everyday. Feels good under makeup! It almost has a matte feeling - sorta like a primer. Definitely not the average face sun CREAM. Gel is in the name, gel is exactly the consistency! I would buy again! * It does not smell good. Especially vs all of their other products. Left a very oily/greasy sheen behind. Ended up taking it back.

Also it absorbs quickly and doesn't leave a whitecast. * I don't have sensitive skin, but after using this for a couple of weeks, my skin was so tender and blotchy. made my regular skincare products sting. stopped using this and my skin was back to normal in about a week. so uh. no. * I used this product for a couple of years. This doesn't work for me. 

Additionally, post-COVID you're getting half the amount of product for the same price. However, I won't be repurchasing because the pump bottle consistantly sprays everywhere and ends up getting the product all over me (and not the back of my hand where I'm trying for!) Because it's such a thin, liquidy formula, a pour component would be much better and less messy because this really is a pain to use. * I do not like the application the pump makes it messy. comments:
* This is by far the best sunscreen gor acne probe skin.  Every sunscreen on the market that says "acne safe" or "non comedigenic" still break me out. If yoy're a dark skintone, you will HAVE to wear fou dation over this, as it does leave the normal mineral sinscreen white cast. * Its moisturizing and leaves a slight white cast for my POC folks and I havent gotten sunburnt while on it. Great for folks with combo, dry, or normal skin types. It does what it says it does, but nothing magnanimous especially considering the price and quantity. Other sunscreens at lower price points get the job done the same, if not better. For acne prone skin, Good Molecules and Hero have good sunscreens as well. Otherwise, its worth a try if you want a physical sunscreen. * This formual is amazing. I love the finish it has and I have no textural problems realplying this every 2 hours. Best sunscreen I've ever tried. * I am in shock at the bad reviews 😂 I am a 30 y.o. brownskin black women and this product works perfect for my combination, acne prone skin. Not sure what smell the negative reviews are referring to - if anything it smells very neutral, barely has a smell. I have used other SPFs that I had to wash off and throw away because of the overwhelming smell but that is not the case with this product. As far blending and applying under makeup, it is 100% effective. I think some people are not using it properly or are not prepping the skin properly or the SPF is not compatible with the skincare products others are using. I have used this SPF on top of PCA skin and Face Reality. I have routine appts with my esthetician who introduced me to this SPF and I have never looked back. A little goes a long and if you have a white cast, you more than likely used too much. I sometimes apply too much but I am able to blend it out which removes the white cast. 10/10 for me! * I used their matte mineral sunscreen for almost 2 years, but as I've started to reach my 30s, my skin is getting more dry. Every mineral sunscreen I've tried has a slight white cast, and you're not going to get away from that with this product either. However it is blendable as it claims to be. 
This one works better with my makeup than the matte sunscreen did. My makeup doesn't seperate over the top of it.

Name: the mug guard broad spectrum spf 30
comments: * It is not as good as people are saying in the reviews. Yes, it blends out well but it just stays on top of your skin and leaves you with a greasy feeling. Also, for the price… definitely not worth it. I couldnt even finish the whole bottle because it was breaking me out so bad. Some people are saying its good for people with acne prone skin but as someone with acne prone skin, yeah it is not it. I gave it to a relative because i didnt want to be wasteful and even they didnt like it and theyre honestly not that picky with their skincare. Korean sunscreens are the way to go especially if youre acne prone and the prices are a lot more cheaper! * This has been my daily sunscreen since the start of this year and don't plan on changing anytime soon! * This is the acne friendly spf out there. I workout outside everyday in FL, so finding an SPF that was water and sweat resistant was important. I have tried so many, but thankfully I found this one. I've had so many bad breakouts from SPFs that claimed to be acne safe but this one actually is. * I'm usually a mineral sunscreen girlie because they don't irritate my eyes, I avoided chemical spfs for ages because they'd sting! But this spf doesn't sting at all, infact it's very gentle on my sensitive skin. It applies smoothly, no white cast at all, and sinks in after about 30 or so minutes. It's not greasy but does leave a dewy finish. Not much scent, but there is a subtle "sunscreeny" smell to it. * I was looking for a travel sized set of sunblock to take on vacation in January and stumbled upon Dune.  The fact it was gel was a huge influence and I bought the set.  Its pretty amazing.  It works into the skin nicely and doesnt leave my hands super sticky afterwards like some lotions do.  We ended up using all 3–the Mug Guard (face), Bod Guard (body) and Life Guard (after burn).  I just repurchased this full size Mug Guard (this is kind of a misnomer, as its only 2.2 oz) as its the one I use the most.  As a caveat, depending on what you have on your face, it *can* leave somewhat of a white cast.  Most of the time I'm fine, but there have been occasions where, depending on what moisturizer/serums I use, it does leave a bit of white on there.  Its not enough to make me stop using it, but its good to keep in mind.  Otherwise, I love the way it absorbs and how it feels. * Initially i thought this would work for me. I lived the fact that it was clear and felt it woudl absorb quickly too. However, having a recent health issue, i was disappointed to find Chemical UV Filters listed in the ingredients. My Dr. mentioned these filters mimic estrogen and can wreak havic with your endocrine system. So unfortunately I cannot risk using this lotion. * I was so pleasantly surprised by this sunscreen. I have extremely sensitive skin, acne, rosacea, eczema, you name it. Finding a sunscreen that doesnt cause a reaction felt impossible but alas sunscreen is a necessity. I took a chance on this when it was on sale because of the glowing reviews truthfully not expecting much other than an overpriced basic sunscreen. I am happy to admit I was wrong. I LOVE this sunscreen. It goes on so well, never breaks my skin out with rashes or acne, and reapplies without becoming a mess. I have started using this on my kids too. I came back to order more and leave this review. The bottle is small but it spreads out very well. 10/10 RECOMMEND if your skin cant tolerate most drug store brands.

I'm multicultural and have melonated skin.

** The longest memoir version of a review below is what's worked for me, tips, and why I'm using it as a dollar-stretching multi-tasker for all skin. Recommended for all skin tones and ethnicities. It's one of FEW products that offers 50 SPF for both face AND body in a healthy, noncommogenic blend and has stayed reasonably affordable despite competitors. 

The Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 SPF IS one of the best sunscreens EVER  - yes it does take a learning curve to dispense small amounts of the liquid-consistency lotion because of the packaging but DON'T let that deter you from such a healthy, full-coverage product. Best of both worlds, covering face and body easily and at a dope price, high SPF, and a little goes a loooooong way! Be patient.....

When you first apply this to your skin it should be the LAST step in whatever your personal process might be, depending on if you're toning, serums, and moisturizing you want to give those other steps at least 30 seconds to 1 minute to absorb into your skin. Then apply this SPF last. You will notice a white cast initially, but it has to process - just like all of us. Give it a minute to absorb into your skin and then look in the mirror because you're going to look and feel like a delicious rockstar  : )

I'm usually indoors throughout the workdays. I apply about a dime size on a reusable cloth face pad and gently swipe then dap over face and neck/breast and some of the top shoulder area - this helps me preserve the sunscreen and not overapply it. I know this is redundant but GENTLY apply/swipe/dab, not wiping or pulling the skin or product too aggressively or too quickly. Then use a little larger amount with hands if needing for allover coverage depending on the day/activities/clothing.

Let it absorb and then continue with your day . 

*Don't assume to apply this and then go about your day outside immediately - within 15 mins you should be about ready to go outside with this glow protection-factor - AFTER the white cast absorbs. 

Humbly put your pride and ego to the side when reapplying later in the day because the sunscreen needs to absorb into the skin again and then it becomes invisible.  If you're wanting a purely sheen/invisible look without the zest of glow, go to the bathroom until it absorbs 1st, or just ignore caring that others might notice that you're protecting your skin.. : ) ... and/or try the brand Supergoop Unseen - but downside on that is it's a smaller container, less SPF, more expensive, and a one or the other type of sunscreen whereas *Black Girl Magic Hybrid is quality AND value for both face AND body,  and keeps skin looking and feeling on point,  glowing,  healthy and protected, not clogging or masking feeling. WINNING! 

I suggest using Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 at home before the day starts and trying the Supergoop Unseen as travel/on the go option for reapplying sunscreen throughout the day.  

Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 sunscreen is for skin. All skin. Regardless of tone, shade, or hue, this sunscreen is a must have! 

Thanks for reading * The consistency is so loose and liquidy. I hate it! This one also leaves a white cast which to me defeats the purpose of its name. I usually buy the og one, but it was completely sold out. They need to work on the formula of this one.

So I almost threw this out, when I decided to try it on my arms and legs so that I wouldn't waste any product and OH. MY. GOD. Literally the best glowy body sunscreen ever. It's not glittery and doesn't look like a spray tan. It just gives the most beautiful natural glow with a touch added coverage. I don't get a reaction to it on my body like I do on my face. Note though that I'm very pale so this might not work on deep skin tones. It's also a very runny product so be careful when opening it and squeezing it out because you actually don't need to really squeeze it, the product will just flow right out. It's kind of annoying but also adds to the benefits of it being good for the body because it means that you need to use less product, so even though it's packaged for the face it provides enough product for the body. Also, I've worn this on my college campus all day and it didn't seem to come off until I took a shower, and it didn't stain or rub off on my clothes! The glow lasted all day without it feeling greasy or leaving any residue on fabrics, so long as I'm careful not to get it on my neckline when I'm applying it. Once it sets on the skin it doesn't budge. I initially bought this from Wegman's on clearance but I'm now buying two more bottles from Ulta for the Summer. * this sunscreen is so amazing for when you want a glowy finish! it wears well under makeup and works wonderfully! * I am in the irritated retinol stage, hoping to be over the hump soon. Name: refreshing water plumping gel serum sunscreen spf 30
comments:
* I did not expect much from this sunscreen at all, honestly. I usually stick with Asian sunscreens as they have exceptionally elegant lightweight formulas with filters far more advanced than those you can find in the US. I got a sample of this, however, and was genuinely surprised by the formula and how it felt on the skin. For reference, I have oily-combination skin, so a light SPF is a must. This sunscreen definitely fit its description of a gel serum- I would say that's definitely how it felt going on (maybe a tad bit more of a gel cream, but still quite light, regardless), and in my experience, it sinks in quite quickly while still leaving the skin feeling the skin hydrated and moisturized. I don't typically use moisturizer when I use this, but that's just what works for my skin personally. I have very sensitive eyes and this also did not sting my eyes at all when applied around my eye area, which is a huge plus for me as that can turn me off from a sunscreen completely. Different things work differently for everyone so I would still recommend getting a sample and trying before spending this much on a sunscreen, especially as there are lots of incredible SPFs that are MUCH more affordable, but finding a sunscreen thats actually enjoyable to use can be extremely hard so I definitely appreciate finding one (a US sunscreen, at that) that feels this nice and would absolutely recommend.

I'm 30 with rosacea, combination dry skin with hormonal breaks out and a thyroid condition that tends to dry my skin and hair out.. I wanted to like this sunscreen but it's a big no. This sunscreen has a very natural satin finish and is very hyrdating without being greasy, while the self reflect spf 30 has a dewy finish and is more lightweight. It takes about 5 minute after application for it to absorb and the cast to disappear. The long term benefits for my very sensitive combo skin have been amazing. The keratosis bumps on my cheeks have completely disappeared and this is the only product I have change in my routine. It has a very subtle vanilla scent that disapears shortly after application. Also the cast is hardly noticable on pale-medium skin. My friend with dark skin borrowed some and said that even though there was a slight white cast for her, it was surprisingly subtle given how high spf it is. This sunscreen has replaced my foundation at this point because  texture of my skin has improved so much since using it. I wish kinship made a body sunscreen like this. Kinship is a solid clean skincare brand and most of my products are from kinship since they are only of the few brands that cause irritation for me. If you have sensitive combo skin I would especially recommend this brand. * After using the kinship self reflect spf 30 for several months, this sunscreen is definately my preference over the self reflect. This sunscreen has a very natural satin finish and is very hyrdating without being greasy, while the self reflect spf 30 has a dewy finish and is more lightweight. It takes about 5 minute after application for it to absorb and the cast to disappear. The long term benefits for my very sensitive combo skin have been amazing. The keratosis bumps on my cheeks have completely disappeared and this is the only product I have change in my routine. It has a very subtle vanilla scent that disapears shortly after application. Also the cast is hardly noticable on pale-medium skin. My friend with dark skin borrowed some and said that even though there was a slight white cast for her, it was surprisingly subtle given how high spf it is. This sunscreen has replaced my foundation at this point because  texture of my skin has improved so much since using it. I wish kinship made a body sunscreen like this. Kinship is a solid clean skincare brand and most of my products are from kinship since they are only of the few brands that cause irritation for me. If you have sensitive combo skin I would especially recommend this brand.

Name: sheer tint sun serum
comments: * I love the way this looks and feels when I put it on. It looks good over or under makeup or just on it's own. Unfortunately it's not for me. After wearing, even though I wash it off before bed, I wake up with welts on my face, a problem I haven't really had before. * I want to preface this by saying I used this religiously for over a year. The last time I purchased it my skin started getting really bad. It was burning, red, itchy, rough, like sandpaper. I almost went to the dermatologist to see what was going on with my skin, I thought it was just changing from age. I hadn't used anything else new but I did let my face heal up for quite some time and tried it again recently, purchasing a completely new bottle thinking I had a bad one. My face is doing the same thing again. So I'm certain this was the problem. I'm not really sure why since I've never had issues before, they had to have reformulated or maybe some bad batches recently, I'm not sure but my skin didn't agree at all! Hoping this helps someone! * I ordered this on a whim , i appreciate mad hippie products for their clean ingredients, this was on sale so I tried it , Wow I was blown away by the coverage and how it beautifully it matched my skin tone .disclaimer I do not have sensitive skin so if you do I would do a patch test since it seems like many reviewers had pretty bad reactions. I had no problems with it at all . Its my new go to and is replacing my current tinted moisturizer . * Left my skin dry and ghostly. I regret my purchase and will be looking for a different tinted moisturizer. * This product was very dangerous for me. Within a few hours of using this my face was extremely itchy, burning, and bright red. It was so bad I went to the ER and they had to call in a dermatologist who diagnosed me with a chemical burn. My face was COVERED in blisters and it led to scarring. I was devastated. I never had any skin issues before using this and after over a year of monthly dermatologist visits my skin is still not fully recovered. * Mad Hippie advertises that their sunscreen is Reef Safe but it contains butyloctyl salicylate which is NOT a reef safe ingredient. I've tried to warn others on social media but they always delete my comment. Stop spreading false info! I used to love this sunscreen, until I had a bad reaction on my face when I put it on a few hours after using an astringent. Previously used it on a daily basis. The bad reaction could have been an anomaly, but the false information I just cannot deal with! * I don't think this sunscreen is for those with drier skin. it seems to peel and under a skin tint, doesn't blend well, since it flakes off. I wanted to like it, given it has vitamin c, hyaluronic acid and does not leave a white cast but I will not be purchasing again.
